Cuando termine su carrera en contaduría, espera viajar a muchos países para ejercer lo aprendido en estos lugares y aprender cada día más de cada país y dejar también una huella, a los 30 años desea tener una casa en donde pueda vivir con su familia que estará conformada por un esposo y dos hijos, un niño y una niña. Darles la mejor de las enseñanzas y que aprendan a valorar todo lo que tienen y con lo cuentan porque para salir adelante, lo importante es nunca dejar el pasado y enseñarles el respeto y amor por la familia. Espera ser muy muy pero muy feliz en todo lo que me queda de vida.
texts.en:
This is María del Pilar, the youngest of two sisters. Throughout her entire schooling, she attended a very good school where she met great friends and classmates.
She's currently 19 years old and studying financial accounting. She studies in an institution where she has obtained a great deal of knowledge which she never thought she could grasp. She has also met several friendly people, and the teachers are very good and friendly. She likes numbers, so that's why she chose this career. She hopes to someday get a degree in accounting.
She enjoys talking to friends and practicing sports such as soccer, volleyball, running and tennis. She likes the colors blue, red and green. She greatly enjoys spending most of her time with her parents and her sister, going for a stroll, playing games, laughing and talking. Later on, these become the most beautiful memories she could have.
She likes to eat chips, candy and ice cream. She enjoys eating a lot of junk food rather than prepared meals. Also, she hates vegetables because she thinks they don't taste good, and she'd rather have chicken and pasta.
Once she finishes studying accounting, she hopes to travel to a lot of countries in order to put what she learned to practice in these locations. She also hopes to learn more about each country every day, and make her mark. At age 30 she hopes to own a house where she can live with her family which will be comprised of a husband and two children, a boy and a girl. She'll provide them with the best possible education and teach them how to appreciate everything they have and own, because in order to get ahead it's important to never forget the past. She'll teach them to respect and love their family. She hopes to be "very, very, so very happy in my entire remaining life".

loans.use: to complete her education program in financial accounting.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 40 years old and single with four children, aged between 10 years and 20 years, two of whom are currently in school. She runs little box business in Tombo, in rural western Sierra Leone. 

Mariatu has been in this business since 2005, selling milk, biscuits, and sugar. She also receives income from her elder daughter (who got married at an early age) because she doesn’t have anyone else to help her take care of the home. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run the business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy food commodities like milk, biscuits and sugar. Mariatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her take care of the home and pay school fees for her younger children. In the future, she would like to open a big shop and send her children to university. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy food commodities like milk, biscuits and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy primary materials for her clothes making business.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a soft drink selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and high cost of transporting raw materials. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconut, mangoes, and passion fruit. She decided to join Kiva's partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts, mangoes, and passion fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children, and to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase compost and other supplies for her plantain trees.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están empezando a trabajar y a aprender en compañerismo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren salir adelante.
 La Sra. Zunilda, es una de las miembros, ella también es la presidenta, comenta que es despensera, y que tiene en venta artículos en general, además de eso productos de primera necesidad. Tiene un negocio bien surtido y que gracias a su esfuerzo está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, frutas, enlatados, leche y demás, ya que estos son los productos que más vende y quiere tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en: The Kuña Group is in its first loan cycle. This collection of women all are working hard and are learning to work together. These women are heads of their households and want to make headway. The group's president, Zunilda, is a storekeeper and sells general supplies as well as products of primary need. She has a well-stocked business that is growing thanks to her hard work. She is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk and other items, since these are the products she sells the most and she wants to keep her store well supplied.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk and other items.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva  is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of one additional family member - a cousin. She has a tailoring business and has been in this tailoring business for six years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. 

She works in Kiyembe at the Kampala city shops six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Eva aspires to build her own business premises and also to start selling her finished clothes on a wholesale basis. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, feeding the family and paying for electricity.  

Eva has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 56-year-old Hawa from Waterloo, a rural area in western Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, aged 10 and 18 years old. One of her children is currently attending school. 

Hawa has been in her cookery business for 38 years. She began her business because she never attended school, and her parent brought her with trading, so up until now she has always been trading for a living. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says at present her business is doing well, and her and her children are able to survive out of the cookery sales.

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more rice, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income generated from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her childrens' school fees. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business to a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El Señor Armando es de la Ciudad de Concepción, él se dedica a la venta de leche hace mas de 10 años y comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de el la leche que vende.
Trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, para poder dar un producto fresco a sus clientes. El desea que conforme pase el tiempo su negocio vaya creciendo y mejorando.
Armando solicita de este crédito para el saneamiento de animales y su campo  Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en: Armando is from the city of Concepción and has made a living selling milk for more than 10 years. He says that he has already built a good customer base that is always buying the milk he sells. He works every day from very early in the morning to be able to give fresh products to his customers. His desire is for his business to keep growing and improving over time. Armando is requesting the loan to pay for sanitation for his animals and fields, and in this way he can keep growing his business and give his family what it needs to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to pay for sanitation for his animals and fields

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
La señora  Martha es una persona  trabajadora y honesta, vive  un  1 hijo  y  un nieto en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos. 
Doña Martha con el préstamo espera comprar 1 batería  y una planta solar por que en la comunidad donde vive no poseen luz eléctrica y esta inversión le beneficiaria mucho. 
Doña Martha  espera mejorar un poco su  calidad  de vida y la de su  familia, con la  compra  de la planta y a la vez sus hijos   podrán   estudiar en horas nocturnas   y recrearse más  con programas  educativos. 
Doña Martha en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore y seguir  apoyando  a  su hijo y nieto  para que se  conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la sociedad. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Martha is an honest and hardworking woman. She lives in the south of Honduras with her son and her grandchild. She works producing staple grains. 
With this loan Martha hopes to purchase a battery and a solar cell because the neighborhood where she lives does not have have electric light and this investment would benefit her a great deal. Martha hopes to improve her quality of life somewhat by purchasing the solar cell, and also her children will be able to study during night hours and participate in recreational and educational programs. 
Martha hopes that in a few years her life and economic situation will improve and that she can continue helping her son and grandchild so they become good people with good social opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras - March of 2013

loans.use: to purchase a solar cell and a battery for her home.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 41 years old. He lives in a small village in the Telavi District with his wife, 20-year-old son and mother. He has previously requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Zaza is working as an electric welder. His wife works as a kindergarten teacher locally. In addition, the family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a vineyard and 300 peach trees. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zaza has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved within the frameswork of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the credit received, Zaza will purchase calves to raise, and will expand the livestock in future. The family will have an additional source of income and they will be able to improve their living conditions in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise, to start a husbandry business.

loans.name: Diosel

texts.en:
Diosel is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a mat weaving business for more than six years now. Diosel is asking for a loan to buy more materials for mat weaving, such as yarn, thread, needles and other items. With this, she will be able to weave more and sell more. 

In the future, Diosel hopes of making her business productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for mat weaving, such as yarn, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El Señor Justino es una persona trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos. 
Don Justino el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  una planta  solar porque en la comunidad donde vive no tienen energía eléctrica, la compra de la planta solar le beneficiaria mucho para poder realizar otras actividades por la noche. 
Don Justino desea que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar un poco su  calidad  de vida y la de su familia, ya  que  sus  hijos podrán  estudiar  de noche  y recrearse más. 
Don Justino en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore y seguir  apoyando  a  sus hijos en sus estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades para  la  sociedad. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en: Justino is a hardworking and honest person who lives with his wife and their three children in southern Honduras. He makes a living growing basic grains. Justino is requesting the loan to purchase a solar panel because there is no electrical service in the community where he lives. Buying the solar panel would help out a lot in doing activities at night. Justino hopes this investment will help him improve the quality of life for himself and his family a little bit, since his children will be able to study and play more at night. He hopes in a few year that his life and economic situation will improve and he can keep supporting his children's education so they can become good people with better opportunities in society.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, an area east of Freetown. She is a widow with one child aged 19 years old, who is currently attending school. She also has nine additional dependents at home. 

Fatmata runs a food vending business at home. She sells palm oil, sugar, rice and cooking oil. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week, 13 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. She began her business because she was going to school but did not proceed any further, and later her father gave her away to be married.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, sugar, rice and cooking oil to re-sell. The extra income from generated from this loan will allow her to increase her business and feed her family. In the future, she plans to educate her child through university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, sugar, rice and cooking oil to re-sell.

loans.name: Aiah Prince's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 3,800,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Aiah is the featured leader of this team. Born in eastern Sierra Leone, 66-year-old Aiah is married to a teacher. Aiah has been a school teacher for eleven years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela earns a living through her food vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her community. 

Estela is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and margarine. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, which will help improve her sales and income. 

In the future, Estela hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, Estela hopes of saving money for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and margarine.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Zainab from Waterloo, and area east of Freetown. She is married with eight children, between the ages of 3 years old and 25 years old. Four of her children attend school. 

Zainab runs a cookery business,She has been running this business since 1994. She works at the business every day, from 4:30 am. Zainab says that the main challenge to her business is transportation constraints.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy foodstuffs, such as rice, and cooking seasonings, along with general stock. The extra income generated from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for her business, such as rice, and cooking seasonings, along with general stock.

loans.name: Crisantemo Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por microempresarios proactivos, son  tres socios que se dedica uno de  ellos es Oscar es casado, tiene 44 años de edad, con cuatro hijos mayores y menores que le ayudan en el negocio desde hace 20 años se dedica a vender flores naturales y artificiales en un mercado populoso de la capital, junto a su esposa que también le ayuda en el negocio, de igual manera tiene 6 años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de rosas, crisantemos, margaritas, flores artificiales, mil flores, tulipán, girasoles etc. Marbelly tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa y Leopoldo tiene 43 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de granos básicos.
texts.en:
This group consists of three members who are proactive micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Oscar. He is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Both the older and younger children help with the business. For the past 20 years, Oscar has been selling natural and artificial flowers at one of the most crowded markets in the capital. His wife also helps with the business. Oscar has been a client of ADIM for six years. His loan will be invested in the purchase of roses, chrysanthemums, daisies, artificial flowers, hydrangeas, tulips, sunflowers, and other products.

Marbelly is 31 years old and has a business of selling cosmetics and clothing. Leopoldo is 43 years old and has a business of selling basic grains.

loans.use: to buy roses, chrysanthemums, daisies, artificial flowers, hydrangeas, tulips, sunflowers, and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Azuncena Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras de Azucena está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas hace la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permite medir el nivel de ingresos de cada una, donde 15 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Justina, quien por medio de la costura esta saliendo adelante y da a su familia lo que necesitan. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que ella sabe lo que hace y a sus clientes les gusta mucho su trabajo. Gracias a que tiene muchas ganas de crecer es que su economía mejora y quiere seguir haciéndolo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, gomas y demás, para que con ello siga invirtiendo en su trabajo y siga teniendo los ingresos que necesita para ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
The group Entrepreneurial Women of Azucena is in its sixth cycle of the women's committee program, wherein each one of the ladies completes the poverty elimination survey which allows them to measure the income level of each member. Fifteen members are currently below the poverty line.
One of the members is Justina who, through embroidery, is getting ahead and is able to provide her family with all its needs. She notes that she has a very good customer base because she knows what she is doing and her customers like her work very much. Thanks to her will to grow her economic situation is improving and she wishes to continue working. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabric, thread, needles, rubber and other goods so that can continue investing in her work and continue earning the income that she needs to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, rubber and other goods.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a farmer from the town of Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She is a married woman, and mother of seven children. 

Fe is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and its harvest.

In the future, Fe hopes of making her business a success and sustainable. In addition, Fe wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 43 years old and is married with five children, aged between 3 and 24 years old. She runs a general store in Waterloo, an area east of Freetown.

She has been in this business since 2003, and sells bread, soap, palm oil, cigarettes, rice and milk from her home. She also earns income from her domestic garden. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different kinds of bread, soap, palm oil, cigarettes, rice and milk to increase her business. She says that the extra income generated from this loan will help her educate her children and buy a plot of land. In the future, she would like to be a distributor. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of stock of bread, soap, palm oil, cigarettes, rice and milk to increase her business.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo is 53 years old. He lives in the Senaki district with his wife, two sons and his retired in-laws. Sergo has previously requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Sergo owns a car. He is renting it out and gets a small monthly income. In addition, the family's income includes Sergo’s parents in-laws' monthly pension. The total income of the family is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses.
 
Sergo has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the credit received, Sergo will purchase a truck for towing cars. He will drive it himself, get private orders and earn additional income for the family.  With the increased income, Sergo will be able to renovate the house that they live in and provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for towing cars.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety store) selling goods and commodities to the people in her community. Flordeliza is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, biscuits, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater and sell more to the buyers thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Flordeliza hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, biscuits, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She complements her ‘Wakye’ by selling doughnuts as well. She usually sells her ‘Wakye’ and doughnuts in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ and doughnuts for twenty years. 

Adjoa is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Adjoa wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of flour, rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Wakye’ and doughnuts. 

In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of flour, rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 35 years old and is married with three children, aged between 6 and 15 years old. She runs a food stand in Waterloo.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings within a busy market area. The main challenge to her business is transportation problems. She started her business to create a permanent source of income to support her family.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to re-sell.  She says that the extra income generated from this loan will help her start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to re-sell.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel,  madre soltera con dos hijos de 16,20 años de edad. Originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Rosibel es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar mucho de actividades recreativa en el parque, y disfrutar de comidas típicas como el nacatamal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería profesional.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de comida. Ella dedica unas 10 horas diaria a su negocio  y lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y comprar productos comestibles para elaborar las comidas como arroz, frijoles, carne, pollo, condimentos, verduras, aceite, aderezos, platos descartables, bolsas plásticas. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rosibel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosibel is a single mother with two children, ages 16 and 20.  She's originally from Managua, a place located in the country's central region.  Rosibel is a hardworking, responsible, woman with a desire for personal success.  She likes to enjoy many recreational activities the park in her spare time, and enjoys typical food such as nacatamales. 

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a food business.  She works 10 hours each day and her business is located in some of the local markets.  The purpose of this loan is to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, meat, chicken, condiments, cooking oil, seasonings, disposable plates, and plastic bags so that she can improve her income in the not too distant future.  Rosibel is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have dignified employment.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Bintimwalimu

texts.en:
Bintimwalimu is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Bintimwalimu has operated a food vending business for the past three years, selling at the market, to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bintimwalimu dreams of expanding to a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cooking fat oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Ruzikul

texts.ru: Рузикул трудолюбивый и добродушный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Рузикул более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Данное время он имеет в обороте 2 коровы и 2 барана. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Он покупает скот, присматривает несколько месяцев и перепродает по более высокой цене на местном рынке. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Очень скоро один из его сыновей собирается жениться. Рузикул нуждается денег для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему осчастливить его сына.
texts.en: Ruzikul is a hardworking and kind man. He is married and is raising five children. Ruzikul has been in animal husbandry for more than twelve years. At this time he has two cows and two rams. His wife helps him in running the business. He buys the cattle then looks after it for a few months and resells at a higher price on the local market. He has own regular customers. Very soon one of his sons is going to get married. Ruzikul needs money to hold a wedding for his son. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni to hold a wedding party. He hopes for your kindness. This loan will help him make his son happy.

loans.use: to have a wedding party for his son.

loans.name: Liliana Amparo

texts.es:
Liliana de 27 años de edad, la conocen en su barrio por su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente vive con su esposo y su hijo de seis años. Los cuales son su motor principal para ir en búsqueda de un mejor futuro.
Cuenta que su esposo labora desde hace más de siete años en una legumbrería, por lo cual aprendió junto a el lo relacionado con las ventas. 
En búsqueda de mejores ingresos económicos, Liliana decidió montar una tienda en la sala de se casa, lo que le permite estar pendiente de su hijo y realizar las labores domésticas.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido con el propósito de brindarles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Al mismo tiempo espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Liliana is 27 years old and is known in her district for her perseverance and her desire to move ahead in life.  She currently lives with her husband and six year old boy, who are her main reasons for going out and looking for a better future.

Liliana tells us that her husband has been working in a vegetable shop for more than seven years and so she too has learnt sales techniques.  With the objective of improving her income, Liliana decided to open her own shop in her home, which allows her to look after her son and do the household chores at the the same time.

Today Liliana is applying for a loan to buy stock so that she can provide customers with a wider variety of products.  At the same time she hopes to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Gibelier Joaquin

texts.es:
Gibelier, es un hombre al que sus amigos admiran  y valoran por su empeño para querer salir adelante. Aprendió desde su juventud a elaborar accesorios con caña de flecha, gracias a sus padres quienes se dedicaron a esta actividad toda su vida. Con su esfuerzo logró montar su propio taller en donde se dedica a la elaboración de productos artesanales. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima con el objeto de continuar con su actividad y mejorar la condición económica de su hogar garantizándoles una mejor condición de vida.
Su mayor sueño es acreditar su negocio y aumentar su número de clientes, espera que en un futuro próximo poder comenzar a exportar su producto para que sea reconocido internacionalmente.
texts.en:
Gibelier is a man who is admired by his friends for his desire to move ahead in life.  In his youth, Gibelier learned to make accessories with "caña flecha" (a natural product used in craft work) from his parents, who made a living from this all their lives.  With some effort, Gibelier managed to start up his own workshop where he makes his artisan products.

Gibelier is currently applying for a loan to buy materials to continue with his work and to improve his financial situation, thus guaranteeing a better quality of life at home.

Gibelier's biggest dream is to build a reputation for his business and increase his number of customers.  He hopes that, in the near future, he will be able to start exporting his products so that he can be recognised internationally.

loans.use: to buy "caña flecha" (a natural product used in craft work).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Jorge Andrés

texts.es:
Jorge, es un joven de 19 años de edad, quien tiene claro que es lo que quiere en la vida. Desde hace un mes comenzó a materializar su sueño de convertirse en el mejor barbero de su localidad. Gracias a la ayuda de su padre quien le pagó el curso en una academia Jorge desarrollo su potencial.
Asegura que su mayor deseo es seguir aprendiendo y poder mejorar la técnica.
Se encuentra laborando diariamente de nueve de la mañana a nueve de la noche. Espera poder aumentar su número de clientes y convertirse en una fuente de empleo para el sector. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de máquina de corte y publicidad, con el propósito de darse a conocer y alcanzar el punto de equilibrio en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 19 years old and is very clear about what he wants in life.  A month ago his dream of being the best barber in town started to become a reality.  Thanks to help from his father who paid for his training course, Jorge was able to realise his potential.  He tells us he wants to continue learning and improving his technique.

Jorge is now working from 9am to 9pm every day.  He hopes to increase his number of customers and become a source of employment for the area.  Now he is applying for a loan to invest in buying clippers and advertising, so that he can be more well known and have a balanced business.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers and advertising.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Even though Emmanuel grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for himself and his family. Currently, Emmanuel is an entrepreneur. He sells sugarcane and works as a driver in Ekumfi-Twa (near Cape Coast). His business enterprises have grown substantially since he began seven years ago. He uses the income from his businesses to help his wife raise their two children. Emmanuel has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for his product and services. Nevertheless he is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus he aims to use his loan to purchase more sugarcane to sell as well as more fuel for his car. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more sugarcane to sell as well as more fuel for his car.

loans.name: Glena

texts.en:
Glena is engaged in the retailing of gasoline and fuel. She is a married woman and has three children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. Glena is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. 

In the future, Glena hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila  is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for six months. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed, vaccines and chicks. She generates additional income through selling used clothes and selling piped water. She works seven days a week and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include defaulters, poultry diseases and seasonality. She aspires to own 3000 chickens and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed, vaccines and chicks

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2. She is married with one child aged 21 years. She also has five additional dependents at home.

Fatmata runs a general stock business; she sells soap, milk, cigarettes, sugar and toothpaste. She has been running this business since 1991. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Fatmata says that at present she is facing insufficient capital to run her business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy general stock like soap, milk, cigarettes, sugar and toothpaste. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her installments. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy general stock like soap, milk, cigarettes, sugar and toothpaste.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Comfort  prepares and sells ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste) in Ekumfi-Twa (near Cape Coast). In addition to that she also sells medicine. She has been doing so for about six years. As a widow with seven children, Comfort uses all her income to provide for her family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, cassava, and over the counter medicines which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ and medicine sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded businesses to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, cassava, and over the counter medicines which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ and medicine sales.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7  socios responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de ate Vitarte. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastida” una de ellas es la Sra. Teresa  de 54 años de edad soltera y con 4  hijos, la Sra. teresa  se dedica ya hace 26  años a la venta de verduras (abarrotes, papas, choclos, cebollas  etc.)  En un pequeño mercado todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos y pagar los gastos de su casa, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Teresa  trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más verduras  y así poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Teresa está sentada es la primera de la mano izquierda y se encuentra con un bolso verde sobre el hombro A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: This group is made up of seven responsible members who have different types of businesses.  They all live in the Vitarte district and the communal bank is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Micaela Bastida".  One member is 54 year old Teresa.  She is single and has four children. For 26 years Teresa has made a living selling vegetables (groceries, potatoes, corn-on-the-cob, onions and more). Teresa goes out every day to a small market with the hope of moving forward in life and being able to pay for her children's school costs and to pay the bills at home.  Her biggest dream is that her children become professionals so, for this, Teresa works a lot.  With this loan, Teresa will buy more vegetables and so have a higher income.  In the photo, Teresa is sitting down - she is the first on the left. Teresa sends hugs to Kiva and promises to achieve all her goals.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mercy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling Millet porridge. She usually sells her porridge in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling porridge for two years. 

Mercy is married and has one child. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Mercy wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of ingredients to make her Millet porridge, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty porridge. In the long term, Mercy plans to re-invest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of ingredients to make her Millet porridge, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is from Waterloo and is in her late thirties. She is married with two children, aged 15 and 20 years old. Her husband is a carpenter with three wives; every wife cares for herself. Fatu started operating a drinks business to create income to support her children and find another husband who will take care of her.    

Fatu runs a little bar at home where she sells beer, pure water and different kinds of assorted drinks. She has been running the business for ten years. She works at the business every day from 10:30 am to 1:00am. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says her main challenges to her business are electricity problems to cool the drinks and transporting the goods from town to her house.

Fatu has requested a loan in order to purchase beer, pure water and different kinds of assorted drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her status. In the future, she plans to open a big bar and restaurant. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase beer, pure water and different kinds of assorted drinks to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old and is married with two children who are aged 16 years and 10 years old. He lives in Nyahururu.

Peter is a farmer and has been doing this for many years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm. 

He hopes to improve his standard of living and give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm.

loans.name: Al-Sabr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sabr and is made up of five women who belong to the same savings group. They live in Dhamar, Yemen. 

The group is requesting financial assistance from Kiva partner AMB in order to raise their level of activity. They have applied for a loan of 210,000 YER. 

Ghada is the group's representative. She is a 32-year-old married woman and has seven children. She is a housewife who tries to improve her childrens' lives. She intends on buying a fridge, and so she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She hopes to live with her children in comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria runs a sari-sari (variety store) business in Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman 

She would like to buy additional goods to sell like rice, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Gloria dreams of expanding her business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like rice, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Saray

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Sarah from Waterloo. She is married with one child who is 10 years old. Her child is currently attending school. 

In 2000, Sarah established her clothing business. She began her business when she graduated from her vocational training center. She usually prepares the local fabric and takes it to a tailor for the product to be finished. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says the high cost of rental is the main problem she faces.

Sarah requires a loan in order to buy a sewing machine. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, Sarah plans to employ staff to sew her products. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Klasina

texts.en:
Klasina is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challengex. Klasina dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With her KES 10,000 loan she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and  cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is a married mother of six children from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in basket making and bamboo matting. She has been in the business for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. 

Gorgonia is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo, straw and varnish. With this, she will be able to weave more and sell more to the market thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, straw and varnish.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Esi sells second-hand clothing in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have eight children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of second-hand clothing, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of second-hand clothing, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Even though Sarah grew up in poverty without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Sarah is an entrepreneur. She sells cooked rice in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she started it six years ago. She uses the income from her business to help raise her four children. 

Sarah has identified an increased demand from consumers for her product. However, she is unable to meet this demand due to limited capacity. She aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 12 and 18. Her children are attending school. 

Mariatu runs a stationery stall where she sells text books, pens, pencils and rulers. She has been running this business since 1994. She works at the business for ten hours per day. Mariatu says that the main challenge to her business is purchasing power is very low.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy more stationery for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to purchase more goods to increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business into a shop. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more stationery for resale.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Georgina did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Georgina works as a baker. She specializes in selling bread and doughnuts in Ekumfi-Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 16 years. As a single mother with four children, Georgina uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Georgina will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of flour, which will aid her in improving her overall bread and doughnut sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of flour.

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en:
Even though Kojo grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for him and his family. 

Currently, Kojo is an entrepreneur. He sells charcoal in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). His business enterprise has grown substantially since he began 15 years ago. He uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their six children. 

Kojo has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for his product. Nevertheless, he is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus he aims to use his loan to purchase more firewood to recover additional quantities of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to recover additional quantities of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 43 years old, and is married with three children who are in school. He is from Ndunyu Njeru. 

Nelson used his previous loan well, and was able to get a good harvest from his farm. He is now applying for another loan to enable him to buy more seedlings and fertilizers to use during this planting season. He is optimistic that the farm will do well.

He hopes to see his business expand and be able to employ workers in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 50 years old and mother to three daughters and one son.

Nadia has been working in her beauty salon for the last 15 years. During her 30 years of experience she has worked with a lot of clients, which has helped her to enhance and improve the services provided in the salon. 

Her previous loan was used to enhance the salon and add a make-up section. Now Nadia is applying for another loan to buy in more cosmetics and make-up products of better quality, in addition to new hair coloring products.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic and make-up products.

loans.name: Mouritala

texts.fr:
Madame   Mouritala est âgée  de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 4  enfants. Elle   vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Darsalam  de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices auprès de ses parents qui se sont spécialisés dans la vente des articles Nigérians dont ils sont originaires. Après plusieurs années à leurs côtés, elle décida d’évoluer  seule  en menant les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers  depuis 8 ans. Sa force de vente est due à sa maitrise du rouage de l’activité et surtout à son prix abordable.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle  sollicite ce prêt. Elle  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 35  mois, après 5 prêts individuels tous  correctement remboursés. Elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter, 60 montres de grand format et 5 cartons de théières, elle s‘approvisionne à Lagos vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt,  elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, qui  permettra de rembourser son prêt et de pérenniser son activité.  Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Madam Mouritala is 31 years old, married and mother to 4 children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Not having gone to school for social reasons, she became interested in income-generating businesses very early with her parents who specialized in the sale of Nigerian items, where they come from. After several years at their side, she decided to progress alone by managing the business of buying and selling a variety of items for 8 years. Her strength in sales is due to her mastery of the parts of this business and especially due to her affordable prices.

Due to the concern of satisfying her clientele, she is requesting this loan. She has been in a relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for 35 months, after 5 individual loans which were all correctly repaid. She is on her 6th individual loan which she plans to use to buy 60 large watches and 5 cartons of teapots. She gets her supplies in Lagos and sells for cash and credit to a mixed clientele.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to ensure the continued existence of her business. Her ambition is to build a house for habitation.

loans.use: to buy 60 large watches and 5 cartons of teapots.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Djeneba  est âgée  de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle   vit dans une famille traditionnelle  au quartier Hamdallaye  de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante d’une école coranique, en plus  de cette activité elle mène des activités génératrices de revenus, qu’elle  débuta  auprès de sa mère qui vendait des articles venant de la Mecque (encens, écharpe, chapelet, etc.). Après plusieurs années passées à ses côtés, elle commence à évolua seule en menant le commerce de draps et de balaies. Elle mène cette activité depuis 15  ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise venant du Burkina Faso.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa demande clientèle, elle  sollicite ce prêt. Elle  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 12  mois après    1er prêt individuel correctement remboursé. Elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter,  15 draps et 333 balaies,  elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso. 
Djeneba  vend au comptant et crédit à une clientèle mixte, Avec ce prêt,  elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 70 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de pérenniser son activité.  Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Djeneba is 44 years old, married and mother to 6 children. She lives in a traditional family in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

A teacher in a Koranic school, she also manages income generating businesses which she started with her mother who sold items coming from Mecca (incense, scarves, rosaries, etc.). After several years at her side, she began to develop alone by managing the sale of sheets and brooms. She has been managing this business for 15 years and enjoys a great experience and clientele. Her strength in sales is due to the quality of her merchandise which comes from Burkina Faso.

Due to the concern of satisfying the demands of her clientele, she is requesting this loan. She has been in a relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months after her 1st individual loan which was correctly repaid. She is on her 2nd individual loan which she plans to use to buy 15 sheets and 333 brooms. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso.

Djeneba sells for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and to ensure the continued existence of her business. Her ambition is to build a house for habitation.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheets and 333 brooms.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guegneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de jus, d’arachide et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur onzième  prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente MAMOU, première personne dans le rang des assises, à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des ingrédients pour le jus dont un sac de sucre avec les revendeurs au marché de Fana, pour ensuite revendre après préparation en jus aux clients de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de jus.
texts.en:
The group Djekafo, consists exclusively of married women who are on average 40 years old, have 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell juice, groundnuts, and a variety of shop items.

The women of the group Djekafo are on their 11th loan in solidarity with Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Mamou, the first person from the left in the row of people sitting, plans to buy ingredients to make juice including a bag of sugar from the resellers at the market in Fana. She will then resell after preparing juice to her customers in town.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used for the needs of her family and partly reinvested in her business selling juice.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of juice.

loans.name: María Estella

texts.es:
María Estella de 68 años de edad, es de origen campesino, trabaja en su tienda desde hace más de 15 años. Con la cual logró sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos y brindarles educación. Con su esfuerzo y disciplina ha logrado mantener en pie su negocio, aunque admite que en ocasiones ha estado apunto de cerrar su local, debido a que algunas personas no le cancelan lo que les vende, por lo cual tomó la decisión de no vender a crédito. 
En la actualidad María se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María Estella, 68, is originally from the countryside. She has worked in her store for more than fifteen years, something that helped her raise her children and pay for their education. With her hard work and discipline, she has managed to keep her business going, although she recognizes that she has been close to closing it due to some customers owing her money and not paying it back. She decided not to sell on credit anymore.

María is now requesting a loan to buy staple food supplies with the intention to offer a better service and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy staple food supplies for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma has operated an open air food-selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a charcoal-selling business, which earns her other source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, and ten sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the last Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, and ten sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She also sells beans. She can be found selling gari and beans in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her gari and beans business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava and beans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava and beans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr Francisco es de ciudad de este, cuenta que es dueño de varios salones comerciales y cuartos que alquila, los que están ubicados en el centro de la ciudad, en lugares muy estratégicos.
Francisco tiene dos hijos mayores que fueron criados y educados por él, ambos ya son profesionales, y gracias al esfuerzo de su papa han salido adelante y hoy son personas de bien que trabajan y salen adelante.
Francisco pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus salones para ampliarlos y restaurarlos para la comodidad de sus inquilinos. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is from Ciudad del Este. He says that he owns a number of commercial establishments and rooms that he rents out, all located in strategic places in the city center. Francisco has two adult children, raised and educated by him. They are both professionals and thanks to their father’s hard work they have progressed and are today persons of good character that work and get ahead.

Francisco is requesting a loan to invest in his properties. He wants to enlarge them and make some improvements that will result in more comfort for the tenants. He appreciates the opportunity given by Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to enlarge and improve the establishments he rents out.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señorita Laura es soltera, no tiene hijos, culmino sus estudios secundarios. Ella fue empleada en una empresa y con el tiempo y con los ahorros que pudo formar se inicio comprando una maquina. Actualmente cuenta con 4 maquinas y una cortadora, y tres empleados, gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido crecer y hoy ya es una gran microemprendedora.
Le gustaría en el futuro ampliar   su negocio por que cuenta con  local propio y una buena cantidad de clientes. se esfuerza mucho y siempre pone todo de ella en lo que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en insumos para su taller, como ser hilos, agujas, telas y demás. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is single and doesn't have children. She finished secondary school. She was employed at a business and with time and the savings she was able to amass, she bought a sewing machine. She currently has 4 sewing machines and a cutter, as well as three employees. Thanks to her efforts her business has been able to grow and now she is a great micro-entrepreneur.

In the future she would like to expand her business because she has her own premises and a good quantity of customers. She works very hard and always puts all of herself into her work.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in items for her workshop, such as thread, needles, fabric and more. She is very thankful to the opportunity she is being given because it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
Freddy  es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Industrial en una Universidad local

La carrera de Freddy dura 05 años, de los cuales va cursando el segundo año. Freddy estudia la carrera de ingeniería industrial animado por su familia quienes se dedican al negocio textil, desde pequeño le gusto ayudar a su familia con el negocio de ropa y calzado que ellos tienen, terminando su carrera quiere impulsar el negocio familiar y ayudar a otras personas dedicadas al rubro de la textileria, el préstamo que ha solicitado será de mucha ayuda para el porqué  podrá pagar la matrícula  y pensiones del nuevo ciclo en la universidad..
Freddy  tiene un mensaje para los inversionistas Kiva: “Gracias por depositar la confianza en los jóvenes y ¡qué bueno que existan personas como ustedes!”.
texts.en:
Freddy is a young industrial engineering student at a local university.

Freddy's degree is 5 years long, and he is in his second year. Freddy is studying industrial engineering, motivated by his family, who work in textiles. Since he was little he has liked to help his family with their clothing and shoe business. When he finishes his degree he wants to promote the family business and help other people who work in textiles.

The loan he has applied for will help him a lot because he will be able to pay tuition and boarding costs for his next semester at university.

Freddy has a message for Kiva investors: "Thanks for putting your trust in youth. It's wonderful that there are people like all of you!"

loans.use: to pay tuition and boarding costs for a semester at university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, groceries, stock in bulk and other supplies for her home based store

loans.name: Medleen

texts.en:
Medleen is a 20-year-old single lady. She has one brother and one sister. 

Medleen goes to a governmental university in the south of Jordan to study to become a teacher. 

She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has five school-going children. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to neighbors and passersby. Halima cites seasonality and high rate of perishability to be her major challenges. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various items to the people in her place. Grace is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, sodas and other beverages, noodles, canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries and others. With this, she will be able to attract more customers and make more sales.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, sodas and other beverages, noodles, canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooked rice with beans in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Abena is married and has four children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice and beans. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of rice and beans

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells uncooked rice and doughnuts in the market of Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. 

Abena has identified that there is growing demand among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice and dough (for her doughnuts) to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and dough (for her doughnuts).

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20 years old and a single guy. He has two sisters and four brothers. Ahmad goes to the university to study literature and he is applying for an educational loan to pay for the rest of his semester fees so he can proceed in submitting his papers for the semester.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of his semester fees

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en: Muhannad is a 22-year-old single guy. He is a third-year student studying to become a gymnastics and sports coach, but recently he faced some financial issues that did not help him in paying the semester fees.  For that reason, he is applying for an educational loan.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with two children.

Aminata runs a bakery business; she sells baked cake and bread. She has been running  the business since she dropped out from school. At that point, she decided to start a business. She works at the business from Monday to Sunday. She also earns income through her garden work (agriculture). Transportation is one of the major challenges she is presently facing: to transport her cassava from the village to town.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy seed for her garden and expand her bakery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children up to university level. In the future, she plans to become the first international cassava bread seller. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy seed for her garden and expand her bakery business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. 

Adjoa is married and has eight children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase larger amounts of charcoal, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of charcoal, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ama sells maize porridge in Ekumfi-Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. 

As a divorcee with four children, Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales of maize porridge. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales of maize porridge.

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
Hafswa is married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has been making natural fruit juice for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of becoming the best supplier of juice in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a freezer to store her juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to store her juice for sale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 37 years old and married. She has two children, ages 7 and 13. Her children are going to school, and she also takes care of one relative at home. 

She runs a general stock business in Waterloo in Sierra Leone. She began this business to support her family since her husband is bike rider and his income is not enough to support the home. She's been in this business for five years and sells bags and t-shirts at the market. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bags and t-shirts for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and buy a generator to improve her home. In the future, she would like to open a shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags and t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. 

For the past 11 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her small bar, which sells drinks such as beer, spirits and wine. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more drinks like beer, soda, wine and spirits to sell in this festive season. It will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a pool table and set up another bar room. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more drinks like beer, soda, wine and spirits to sell in this festive season.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: Zacarías de 33 años de edad esta casado con Maura y tiene hijos pequeños con quienes vive en la casa construida a base de madera .Posee una parcela de tamaño considerable en donde desarrolla actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico.Se inicio hace 13 años de manera independiente ya que sus abuelos le otorgaron un terreno agrícola en calidad de herencia por ser uno de los nietos preferidos en merito a la dedicación que demostró en labores agrícolas.Con el paso de los años y al formar una familia demostró que el campo es una buena manera de ganarse la vida.Sus tareas parten desde brindarle a las plantaciones cacaoteras las atenciones del caso con el objetivo de lograr mazorcas de calidad, puesto que de ello depende el precio final que le otorgan los acopiadores.Contando con el constante apoyo de Maura y sus hijos en labores menores viene actualmente realizando el primer deshierbo de campaña esperando evitar que la mala hierba consuma los nutrientes de sus terrenos. No obstante al ser un área considerable acostumbra convocar a trabajadores del lugar para agilizar las tareas pendientes.Sus objetivos a largo plazo son el de iniciarse en la producción de café orgánico puesto que el precio de los granos viene presentando un precio considerable en las ultimas temporadas.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y esta agradecido por esta gran oportunidad razón por la cual se compromete a cumplir de manera responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Desea contar con S/.4,000 nuevos soles para adquirir un terreno adicional y asi expandir su producción de cacao orgánico.
